Set #41049 Panda’s Bamboo: To end the Series 6 animal sets from LEGO Friends here is a set that… is lackluster. Why? Well we’ll discuss that in the bulk of the review, but suffice it to say the primary model in this set doesn’t really do it for me. On to the pro cons section of the review.

column2: New Panda animal sculpt, different from the new bear sculpt for animal pieces we got in Series 5. Cute little piece that… can be an animal or a stuffed teddy I suppose.
Main model is quick to build and ready for play in moments. Nice use of pieces also, especially to make the bamboo.

Generic looking model. It’s pretty much a small climbing structure for the panda, and across it lays what I’m assuming is a log for crossing one area to get to the slide. The bamboo is the leafy stick clipped to the back.
Animal sculpt looks a bit off compared to other animal sculpts, it seriously looks like an overgrown stuffed bear, especially with the bow on it and looks the least useful for building a LEGO zoo.

column1: I’m not a big fan of the main model in this set. It might work for that zoo I keep mentioning as a panda habitat. I just find it a bit too generic looking for my tastes, I think it could have used a bit better design. I just don’t know why most of these animal habitats/homes need to include slides all the time. And all the jumper plates detract a little from the symmetry of the set. What this means is I would mostly recommend this for the fans only, other AFOLs, TFOLs and KFOLs might prefer to stick with other sets for unique parts. Since this set really doesn’t have any to speak of.
